controlList.title: Smart AI Widgets
controlList.description: Highlights smart widgets to enhance the functionality and user experience.

subItems.title: Stock Forecasting
subItems.description: An AI-driven chart that predicts the future stock trends based on historical data. If the key is not specified, the chart will generate random data.

subItems.title: Data Preprocessing
subItems.description: AI-powered data cleaning and preprocessing work with the smart chart widget.

subItems.title: Smart Charts
subItems.description: AI-powered chart generator creates interactive and dynamic charts.

subItems.title: Smart Filtering
subItems.description: This sample showcases how Smart Filtering enhances a DataGrid displaying medical diagnostics. With AI, users can retrieve relevant results using related terms—for example, searching 'stomach' returns entries like 'Abdominal pain'.

subItems.title: Maps
subItems.description: This sample integrates with Google Generative AI and allows users to search for locations. Without an API key it works with offline data, while with a key it provides accurate map results.

subItems.title: Calendar
subItems.description: This smart appointment generator lets users check the doctor availability and book appointments.

subItems.title: Smart Fill
subItems.description: This sample illustrates how the Syncfusion Flutter PDF Viewer, with the help of AI, can automatically fill form fields using the content copied by the user.

subItems.title: Summarizer
subItems.description: This sample illustrates how the Syncfusion Flutter PDF Viewer, with the help of AI, can provide intelligent document summarization and contextual responses to user queries about PDF content.

controlList.title: AI Assist View
controlList.description: AIAssistView is a versatile widget design to enhance interaction between users and AI services.

controlList.title: Barcodes
controlList.description: Generate and display data in machine-readable 1D and 2D barcodes

controlList.title: Treemap
controlList.description: Visualize hierarchically structured data that is sized and colored by quantitative variables

controlList.title: Cartesian Charts
controlList.description: Plot over 30 chart types ranging from line charts to financial charts

subItems.title: Default line chart
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the default line chart. Marker, tooltip and legend are enabled in this sample. Tap the marker to view information about that data point in a tooltip.

subItems.title: Line with dashes
subItems.description: Line chart is rendered with dashes in this sample.

subItems.title: Multi-colored line
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the rendering of a line chart with multiple colors. Colors for each data point is mapped from the data source.

subItems.title: Line zone
subItems.description: This sample is achieved by filling the linear gradient to the line series. Gradient’s color stops are formed based on the zone’s (segments) start and end values. This scenario is achieved by using the ‘onCreateShader’ callback in ‘SfCartesianChart’.

subItems.title: Modified axis base
subItems.description: This sample is achieved using the axis crossing feature. X-axis 'crossAt' value is set to -2 and hence the data points are rendering from -2. Default axis base value is 0 and on that case, positive points will render upwards and negative points will render downwards.

subItems.title: Back to back column
subItems.description: By default, the columns of various series are placed side by side. In this sample, it is changed to render back to back

subItems.title: Column with track
subItems.description: This sample renders the column chart with track. Track is a rectangular bar drawn from minimum to maximum values of an axis.

subItems.title: Column width and spacing
subItems.description: You can change the width and spacing of columns by using the options in the properties panel.

subItems.title: Customized column chart
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the rendering of custom columns. Here, the top edges of the columns are changed to form a triangle.

subItems.title: Spline types
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates various types of splines. Type can be changed by modifying the options in the properties panel.

subItems.title: Area zone
subItems.description: This sample is achieved by filling the linear gradient to the area series. Gradient’s color stops are formed based on the zone’s (segments) start and end values. This scenario is achieved by using the ‘onCreateShader’ callback in ‘SfCartesianChart’.

subItems.title: Modified axis base
subItems.description: This sample is achieved using the axis crossing feature. X-axis 'crossAt' value is set to -2 and hence the data points are rendering from -2. Default axis base value is 0 and on that case, positive points will render upwards and negative points will render downwards.

subItems.title: Area with empty points
subItems.description: This area chart sample renders with gap for null values (empty data points).

subItems.title: Bar width and spacing
subItems.description: You can change the width and spacing of the bars by using the options in the properties panel.

subItems.title: Bar with track
subItems.description: This sample renders the bar chart with track. Track is a rectangular bar drawn from minimum to maximum values of an axis.

subItems.title: Customized bar chart
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the rendering of custom bars. Here, the bars are filled with images, to look like  pattern fill.

subItems.title: Bubble filled with gradient
subItems.description: This sample depicts the bubble chart filled with gradient colors.

subItems.title: Scatter with various shapes
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the rendering of a scatter chart with various shapes.

subItems.title: Step line with dashes
subItems.description: A step line chart is rendered with dashes in this sample.

subItems.title: Vertical step line chart
subItems.description: The axes in this sample are transposed to form a vertical step line chart.

subItems.title: List
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates plotting the data which is stored as a list.

subItems.title: JSON
subItems.description: This same demonstrates binding of JSON data to the chart. We saved the JSON data in the file 'chart_data.json' in the assets folder.

subItems.title: Infinite scrolling
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the infinite scrolling functionality. When horizontal scrolling reaches the end of the chart, more data will be loaded and a circular progress indicator will be shown until loading.

subItems.title: Arranged by index
subItems.description: By default, category data points will be arranged based on the x values. In this sample, you can arrange the data points based on the index value.

subItems.title: Date time axis with label format
Maximum width for labels
subItems.description: Maximum width for axis labels can be specified using the maximumLabelWidth property. The maximum space occupied by the axis labels can be changed using the labelsExtent property. A tooltip will be shown on clicking/tapping the trimmed axis label in both cases.

subItems.title: Point color mapping
subItems.description: This sample depicts mapping different colors to each data point from the data source using the <highlight>pointColorMapper[https://pub.dev/documentation/syncfusion_flutter_charts/latest/charts/CartesianSeries/pointColorMapper.html]<endHighlight> property.

subItems.title: Gradient based on values
subItems.description: This sample is achieved by filling all the data points in column series with a linear gradient that is proportional to the size of the chart’s plot area. This scenario is achieved by using the ‘onCreateShader’ callback in ‘SfCartesianChart’.

subItems.title: Chart with annotation
subItems.description: This sample renders the cartesian chart with annotation. A pie chart is rendered as an annotation here.

subItems.title: Chart with watermark
subItems.description: In this sample, annotation is placed at the center of the chart with reduced opacity to form a watermark

subItems.title: Sorting options
subItems.description: This sample depicts the sorting feature in a chart. The data points can be sorted in the ascending or descending order based on the x or y value.

subItems.title: Default tooltip
subItems.description: Tooltip is enabled in this sample and to see the tooltip in action, tap the data points in mobile and hover the data points in the web.

subItems.title: Tooltip position
subItems.description: By changing the options, the tooltip can be made to display in the fixed location or at the pointer location itself.

subItems.title: Tooltip template
subItems.description: This example displays a custom widget as the tooltip. To see the tooltip template, tap the data points in mobile and hover the data points in the web.

subItems.title: Pinch zooming
subItems.description: Pinch zooming and panning is enabled in this sample. Pinch the chart to zoom in and swipe the zoomed chart to pan it. In the web, mouse wheel zooming is also enabled.

subItems.title: Selection zooming
subItems.description: This sample depicts the working of selection zooming. Long press and drag on the chart to select the region for zooming.

subItems.title: Zooming with custom buttons
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates zooming and panning with custom buttons.

subItems.title: Chart with crosshair
subItems.description: The crosshair is enabled in this sample. Tap the chart to show the crosshair and drag the chart to constantly change the crosshair position. On the web, you can move the cursor over the chart area to display the crosshair.

subItems.title: Chart with trackball
subItems.description: The trackball is enabled in this sample. Tap the chart to show the trackball and drag the chart to change the position of the trackball continuously. On the web, you can move the cursor over the chart area to display the trackball.

subItems.title: Customized trackball
subItems.description: This example displays a custom widget as the trackball. To see the customized trackball, tap the chart area in mobile and hover the chart area on the web.

subItems.title: Selection modes
subItems.description: This sample depicts the selection feature in the chart. In mobile, tap the data points and on web/desktop click the data points to select or deselect them.

subItems.title: Dynamic selection
subItems.description: This sample depicts the dynamic selection feature achieved using the 'selectDataPoints' public method. Choose the series and point index from the dropdown to select or unselect the data points.

subItems.title: Data point events
subItems.description: Tap on a data point to display additional information in the snack bar. Double-tap on it to navigate to that site and long press on it to get the sorting options. This is achieved by using the onPointTap, onPointDoubleTap and onPointLongPress callbacks.

subItems.title: Events
subItems.description: Various chart callbacks are enabled in this example. It displays the event trace details while rendering and on performing various interactions.

subItems.title: Navigation with events
subItems.description: Tap/click on the axis labels, data points or on the data labels for navigating to an external link.

subItems.title: Add a point on click
subItems.description: This example depicts the pixel to data point conversion feature. Tap/click on the chart area to add a data point dynamically on that location.

subItems.title: Pagination
subItems.description: This sample shows how to view the next set of data on swiping the chart using the 'onPlotAreaSwipe' callback function. You can swipe from left to right or vice versa and also click on the days at the bottom to view the next set of data.

subItems.title: Auto Scrolling
subItems.description: In this sample, the data is being added every second. The chart is scrolled to the end automatically to view the current data and you can pan the chart from left to right direction to view the previous data points.

subItems.title: Real-time spline chart
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the live chart. A new data point is added at the end and a point is removed at the start in certain time interval continuously.

subItems.title: Vertical live chart
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the live chart. A new data point is added at the end  in certain time interval continuously.

subItems.title: Programmatic
subItems.description: Add or remove the data points from a chart using the buttons placed in the sample.

subItems.title: Interaction
subItems.description: This example depicts the pixel to data point conversion feature. Tap/click on the chart area to add a data point dynamically on that location.

subItems.title: Add/remove series
subItems.description: Add or remove series from the chart using the buttons placed in the sample.

subItems.title: Update data source
subItems.description: The data source bound to this chart can be changed with random values dynamically, by tapping the button placed in this sample.

controlList.title: Circular Charts
controlList.description: Visualize the data using pie, doughnut, and radial bar charts

subItems.title: Pie with various radius
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the pie chart with different radius for all the slices. The radius of a slice is based on a numeric value.

subItems.title: Grouping
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the grouping functionality in the pie chart. Data points whose values are less than the specified value will be grouped together

subItems.title: Gradient fill
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to apply different types of gradient to the pie slices. Here you can apply the linear, sweep, and radial gradients using the dropdown menu in the property panel.

subItems.title: Image fill
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to fill the pie slices with various images for each slice using the 'ImageShader'.

subItems.title: Point render mode
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to fill the pie slices with various images for each slice using the 'ImageShader'.

subItems.title: Center elevation
subItems.description: The doughnut chart is rendered with elevated circle at the center using annotations feature in this sample.

subItems.title: Gradient fill
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to apply different types of gradient to the doughnut slices. Here you can apply the linear, sweep, and radial gradients using the dropdown menu in the property panel.

subItems.title: Customized radial bar chart
subItems.description: This sample renders the radial bar chart with annotation at the center and templated legend.

subItems.title: Gradient fill
subItems.description: This sample renders the radial bar chart with gradient.

subItems.title: Tooltip
subItems.description: By changing the options, the tooltip can be made to display in the fixed location or at the pointer location itself.

subItems.title: Selection
subItems.description: This sample depicts the selection feature in the chart. In mobile, tap the data points and on web/desktop click the data points to select or deselect them.

subItems.title: Dynamic selection
subItems.description: This sample depicts the dynamic selection feature achieved using the 'selectDataPoints' public method. Choose the point index from the dropdown to select or unselect the data points.

controlList.title: Radial Gauge
controlList.description: Visualize one or multiple measures on a circular scale with pointers and ranges

subItems.title: Widget pointer
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to use a custom widget as a pointer using the 'WidgetPointer'.

controlList.title: Linear Gauge
controlList.description: Visualize one or multiple measures on a linear scale with pointers and ranges

subItems.title: Drag behavior
subItems.description: Free mode is the default mode and markers move back and forth freely on a gauge. When set to constrained mode, it cannot move beyond the markers on both sides.

controlList.title: Funnel Chart
controlList.description: Visualize the sequential data using funnel chart

controlList.title: Pyramid Chart
controlList.description: Visualize the organized data using pyramid chart

controlList.title: Maps
controlList.description: Easily visualize data over a geographical area

subItems.title: Arcs and Lines
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how the arc layer and the line layer can be used for denoting the air routes between the different locations.

subItems.title: Polylines
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how the polyline layer can be used for denoting the road routes between the two locations.

subItems.title: Polygon
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how the default and inverted polygons can be used to denote a particular area

controlList.title: Circular ProgressBar
controlList.description: Indicates the progress of a task with customizable visuals. Designed using Radial Gauge widget.

controlList.title: Spark/Micro Charts
controlList.description: Light-weight line, area, column and win-loss charts which fits in a very small area.

subItems.title: Customization
subItems.description: This example depicts various useful features available in Spark charts. Enable the marker, data label, trackball, range band and also change the axis value with the options in the properties panel.

subItems.title: Sparkline in Grid
subItems.description: This example depicts the rendering of Syncfusion Flutter Spark Charts in the cells of the Syncfusion Flutter Data Grid widget.

controlList.title: DataGrid
controlList.description: Displays large amounts of data with different data types in a tabular view

subItems.title: Custom Header
subItems.description: In this sample, the dropdown icon is loaded along with the text to the header cell. If you click the header cell, the popup menu options will be shown. You can sort that specific column.

subItems.title: Sorting
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to sort one or more columns. In the Web and Windows platforms, you can sort multiple columns by tapping the column header with the CTRL key and COMMAND key in macOS platform where as in a mobile platform you can tap the column headers. It also provides some additional functionalities like Tri-state sorting and displaying sort numbers that indicate the sort order.

subItems.title: Custom Sorting
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates custom sorting in DataGrid. In this sample, Customer Name column is sorted based on the length of a cell value.

subItems.title: Custom Grouping
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates the custom grouping capabilities in SfDataGrid. Implement custom grouping logic if the standard grouping techniques do not meet your requirements. The sample is grouped based on the total amount of sales in the quarters.

subItems.title: Column Resizing
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to resize the columns. In the Desktop platforms, resize columns by clicking and dragging the right (left in RTL mode) border of a column header. In the mobile platforms, when the column is long pressed the indicator will be displayed at the right border of a column header, Then, tap and drag the indicator to resize columns.

subItems.title: Context Menu
subItems.description: This sample demonstrates how to show a context menu when a cell is long pressed in mobile platforms and right clicked in desktop platforms.

controlList.title: Event Calendar
controlList.description: Allows you to easily visualize and schedule appointments

controlList.title: Date Range Picker
controlList.description: Allows to easily select dates or range of dates

controlList.title: PDF Viewer
controlList.description: View the PDF document seamlessly and efficiently

controlList.title: PDF
controlList.description: Create PDF document with text, images and tables

controlList.title: XlsIO
controlList.description: Create Excel documents with text, numbers, cell formatting, formulas, charts, images, and more

controlList.title: Signature Pad
controlList.description: Captures the signature and save it as an image to sync across devices and documents

controlList.title: Chat
controlList.description: Displays a conversation between two or more users in a layout that is highly customizable.

controlList.title: Slider
controlList.description: The horizontal slider enables you to select a date or a numeric value

controlList.title: Range Slider
controlList.description: The horizontal range slider enables you to select a date or a numeric range

controlList.title: Vertical Slider
controlList.description: The vertical slider enables you to select a date or a numeric value

controlList.title: Vertical Range Slider
controlList.description: The vertical range slider enables you to select a date or a numeric range

controlList.title: Range Selector
controlList.description: Visualize data and select a date or numeric range

controlList.title: Radial Slider
controlList.description: Selects a numeric value in a radial scale. Designed using Radial Gauge widget.

controlList.title: Radial Range Slider
controlList.description: Selects a numeric range in a radial scale. Designed using Radial Gauge widget.
